procedural_fairness: extension granted if application within one year
just and equitable to grant application

application_details: Mr. Heron's lawyer missed the 90-day deadline by two days due to a computational error. He promptly sought an extension from the Minister and then the Court.
decision_reasoning: The delay was minor, unintentional, and did not prejudice the Minister, aligning with the 'just and equitable' standard.
procedure_followed: Mr. Heron first requested an extension from the Minister, which was denied. He then applied to the Federal Court under s. 129.2 of the Customs Act.
result_of_case: The Court granted Mr. Heron's application for an extension of time, deeming the objection timely filed.
